p: The mean incubation period of SARS-CoV-2 is estimated to be 3–7 days (range, 2–14 days) [46, 47], indicating a long transmission period of SARS-CoV-2. It is estimated that SARS-CoV-2 latency is consistent with those of other known human CoVs, including non-SARS human CoVs (mean 3 days, range 2–5 days) [48], SARS-CoV (mean 5 days, range 2–14 days) [49] and MERS-CoV (mean 5.7 days, range 2–14 days) [50]. Moreover, it has been reported that asymptomatic COVID-19 patients during their incubation periods can effectively transmit SARS-CoV-2 [51, 52], which is different from SARS-CoV because most SARS-CoV cases are infected by ‘superspreaders’ and SARS-CoV cases cannot infect susceptible persons during the incubation period [53]. Taken together, these data fully support the current period of active monitoring recommended by the WHO of 14 days.
